  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours

    Morning | Face The
    Nation 















Hi everyone,
 
Our top story tonight is the U.K. terror plot, which is being investigated
  on both sides of the Atlantic. We have a
  trio of correspondents working on the story from London,
  Glasgow and here in the United States.
 
Mark Phillips will have the very latest on the
  investigation into the London and Glasgow attacks as authorities
  have raised their threat alert to its highest level –
  “critical.” The British government has linked the attempted car
  bombings to al Qaeda, and several suspects, including three doctors, have
  been arrested in connection with the plots. Sheila MacVicar will tell us more
  about these suspects.
 
In response to the overseas threat, what is the United States
  doing to secure its transportation infrastructure? Nancy Cordes will have the
  latest from airports around the country.
 
In Iraq,
  a U.S. military official
  is accusing Iran
  of using its militant group Hezbollah to arm Shiite militants. Our chief
  foreign correspondent Lara Logan reports the American military believes that Hezbollah
  had prior knowledge of a deadly attack killing five Americans in Karbala earlier this
  year.
 
Turning our attention back home, our chief White
  House correspondent Jim Axelrod will report on the race for ’08. Now
  that Barack Obama boasted a donation bankroll of $32.5 million – $10
  million more than Hillary Clinton earned this quarter – Clinton is calling on Bill,
  her not-so-secret weapon.
 
A congressional report criticized the CDC for
  wasting hundreds of millions of taxpayers’ dollars – and wait
  until you hear the lavish details. Sharyl Attkisson will have this surprising
  story.
 
Finally tonight, Cynthia Bowers will report on a
  sting operation of sorts – or at least an operation by ex-cons who
  could get stung by the bees they keep.
 
I hope you’ll join us tonight,
 




Katie Couric
CouricandCo@cbs.com
